item.title: The channel line at the crossing near the Co-operative store and the Balti Hut is incorrect with water lying there after rainfall as the adjacent road gully is too high. Water builds up and anyone using the crossing gets soaked as cars drive past. Realignment of channel/ gully required., 17th November
item.description:
At the pedestrian crossing o/s Balti Hut on Cheltenham Road near Elmbridge Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 131, Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 17th November
item.description:
EY102GH1902000036077-02 london road works: Reconstruction of collapsed headwall. This will require an excavation to go into the A40 with a new drainage system and concrete retaining wall installation. Traffic through Whittington Parish As chairman of this parish I have received numerous complaints about a significant increase in traffic volumes on the back lanes to and from Cheltenham and through the village, as well as the use of these routes by heavy vehicles; this coincides with the prolonged closure of the A40 in Charlton Kings. Of the lanes in question, Ham Hill lane is single carriageway and Arle Grove lane is not much better. As a case in point, the recent attempt of an oil tanker to negotiate a right-angled bend on the latter at dusk caused major confusion with rush hour traffic up the hill from Charlton Kings, the tanker being unable to reverse back up the lane. The village lane out of Rectory Corner up to Whalley Farm feeds both these routes and is itself single track, albeit with the occasional passing place. It is usual to have to reverse to allow vehicles to pass. In Whittington itself this extra traffic is adding to the problems for walkers between Rectory Corner to the centre of the village, on a long bend with limited visibility, no footpath, and no verge; it is therefore necessary to walk on the actual lane. It is felt that this undesirable situation could be improved by the installation of suitable signage such as has been seen elsewhere locally, such as "No diverted traffic", "Not suitable for heavy vehicles", and "Do not follow SatNav". Additionally, safety at the junction of the village road with the A40 would be improved by the installation of a full set of junction markers.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles
